# angle

**Instance Property**

The angle, in radians, of the force vector for the behavior.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var angle: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default angle is `0` radians, using standard UIKit geometry. To configure the force vector for a push behavior, set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPushBehavior/magnitude] property as well as the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPushBehavior/angle] property.

Alternatively, you can express the direction of force by using *x* and *y* components with the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPushBehavior/pushDirection] property. Whichever approach you use, the alternate, equivalent values update automatically.

## Configuring a push behavior

- **setAngle(_:magnitude:)**: Sets the angle and magnitude of the force vector for the behavior.
- **magnitude**: The magnitude of the force vector for the push behavior.
- **mode**: Returns the force mode for the push behavior.
- **setTargetOffsetFromCenter(_:for:)**: Sets the offset, from the center of a dynamic item, at which to apply the push behavior’s force vector.
- **targetOffsetFromCenter(for:)**: Returns the offset, from the center of a dynamic item, at which the push behavior’s force vector is applied.
- **pushDirection**: The direction of the force vector for the behavior, expressed as *x* and *y* components and using standard UIKit geometry.
